getAvatarUrl > returns a gravatar URL for an email with uppercase characters

getAvatarUrl > returns a gravatar URL for an email with special characters

chunk > should handle arrays that cannot be divided evenly
chunk > should return an empty array when given an empty array

chunk > should return an array of single-item arrays when the chunk size is 1

formatDate > returns an empty string for undefined date
formatDate > returns an empty string for invalid date string

debounce > should delay the execution of the function

debounce > should use the correct context when calling the function

groupBy > groups items by number floor

groupBy > groups items by identity for non-array items

initials > returns initials for a name with non-alphabetic characters
isEqual > should return true for identical primitive values
isEqual > should return false for different primitive values
isEqual > should return true for identical object values
isEqual > should return false for different object values
isEqual > should return true for identical nested object values
isEqual > should return false for different nested object values
isEqual > should return true for identical arrays
isEqual > should return false for different arrays
isEqual > should return true for identical nested arrays
isEqual > should return false for different nested arrays
offsetDate > returns the current date when no offset is provided

offsetDate > handles year change correctly when offset is positive
offsetDate > handles year change correctly when offset is negative
offsetDate > handles leap year correctly
orderBy > sorts items by multiple keys and orders
orderBy > returns an empty array for an empty array input

randomNumber > handles ranges that include zero

randomElement > should return the only element for a single-element array
randomElement > should handle arrays with different types

generateRandomWords > returns a string with words from the provided word list

generateRandomWords > handles an empty word list by returning an empty string
range > returns an array of numbers from start to end with positive step
range > returns an array of numbers from start to end with negative step
range > returns an empty array if end is less than start and step is positive
range > returns an empty array if start is less than end and step is negative
range > returns an array with one element if start equals end
range > returns an array from 0 to end if only end is provided
sortBy > sorts items by string
sortBy > sorts items by number using a key getter function

sortBy > returns the same array for an array with one item
remove > removes items that satisfy the predicate

remove > removes all items when all items satisfy the predicate
remove > does not modify the array when it is empty
